text:
Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy,
To the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: We ought always to give thanks to God for you, brothers and sisters, as is only fitting, because your faith is increasing abundantly, and the love of each and every one of you toward one another grows ever greater.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a result, we ourselves speak proudly of you among the churches of God for your perseverance and faith in the midst of all your persecutions and afflictions which you endure.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a plain indication of God’s righteous judgment so that you will be considered worthy of the kingdom of God, for which you indeed are suffering.
speaker: Narrator

text: For after all it is only right for God to repay with affliction those who afflict you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to give relief to you who are afflicted, along with us, when the Lord Jesus will be revealed from heaven with His mighty angels
speaker: Narrator

text: in flaming fire, dealing out retribution to those who do not know God, and to those who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: These people will pay the penalty of eternal destruction, away from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of His power,
speaker: Narrator

text: when He comes to be glorified among His saints on that day, and to be marveled at among all who have believed—because our testimony to you was believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: To this end also we pray for you always, that our God will consider you worthy of your calling, and fulfill every desire for goodness and the work of faith with power,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the name of our Lord Jesus will be glorified in you, and you in Him, in accordance with the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we ask you, brothers and sisters, regarding the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together to Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you not be quickly shaken from your composure or be disturbed either by a spirit, or a message, or a letter as if from us, to the effect that the day of the Lord has come.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one is to deceive you in any way! For it will not come unless the apostasy comes first, and the man of lawlessness is revealed, the son of destruction,
speaker: Narrator

text: who opposes and exalts himself above every so-called god or object of worship, so that he takes his seat in the temple of God, displaying himself as being God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not remember that while I was still with you, I was telling you these things?
speaker: Narrator

text: And you know what restrains him now, so that he will be revealed in his time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the mystery of lawlessness is already at work; only He who now restrains will do so until He is removed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then that lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord will eliminate with the breath of His mouth and bring to an end by the appearance of His coming;
speaker: Narrator

text: that is, the one whose coming is in accord with the activity of Satan, with all power and false signs and wonders,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with all the deception of wickedness for those who perish, because they did not accept the love of the truth so as to be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason God will send upon them a deluding influence so that they will believe what is false,
speaker: Narrator

text: in order that they all may be judged who did not believe the truth, but took pleasure in wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we should always give thanks to God for you, brothers and sisters beloved by the Lord, because God has chosen you from the beginning for salvation through sanctification by the Spirit and faith in the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was for this He called you through our gospel, that you may obtain the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, brothers and sisters, stand firm and hold on to the traditions which you were taught, whether by word of mouth or by letter from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself and God our Father, who has loved us and given us eternal comfort and good hope by grace,
speaker: Narrator

text: comfort and strengthen your hearts in every good work and word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brothers and sisters, pray for us that the word of the Lord will spread rapidly and be glorified, just as it was also with you;
speaker: Narrator

text: and that we will be rescued from troublesome and evil people; for not all have the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord is faithful, and He will strengthen and protect you from the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have confidence in the Lord concerning you, that you are doing, and will do, what we command.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord direct your hearts to the love of God and to the perseverance of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we command you, brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you keep away from every brother or sister who leads a disorderly life and not one in accordance with the tradition which you received from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you yourselves know how you ought to follow our example, because we did not act in an undisciplined way among you,
speaker: Narrator

text: nor did we eat anyone’s bread without paying for it, but with labor and hardship we kept working night and day so that we would not be a burden to any of you;
speaker: Narrator

text: not because we do not have the right to this, but in order to offer ourselves as a role model for you, so that you would follow our example.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even when we were with you, we used to give you this order: if anyone is not willing to work, then he is not to eat, either.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we hear that some among you are leading an undisciplined life, doing no work at all, but acting like busybodies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we command and exhort such persons in the Lord Jesus Christ to work peacefully and eat their own bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, brothers and sisters, do not grow weary of doing good.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone does not obey our instruction in this letter, take special note of that person so as not to associate with him, so that he will be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet do not regard that person as an enemy, but admonish that one as a brother or sister.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now may the Lord of peace Himself continually grant you peace in every circumstance. The Lord be with you all!
speaker: Narrator

text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand, and this is a distinguishing mark in every letter; this is the way I write.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
speaker: Narrator
